data.message: It seems like you're just saying hello! How can we get started with your game project in Pygame? Have you written any code yet, or are you looking for some general guidance on where to begin?

data.documentText:
import pygame
import sys

# Initialize Pygame
pygame.init()

# Set up some constants
WIDTH = 640
HEIGHT = 480
SPEED = 2

# Create the game window
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((WIDTH, HEIGHT))

# Define some colors
RED = (255, 0, 0)

# Initialize the square's position and velocity
square_x = WIDTH // 2
square_y = HEIGHT // 2
dx = SPEED
dy = SPEED

# Game loop
while True:
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            pygame.quit()
            sys.exit()

    # Move the square
    square_x += dx
    square_y += dy

    # Bounce off the edges
    if square_x < 0 or square_x > WIDTH - 50:
        dx = -dx
    if square_y < 0 or square_y > HEIGHT - 50:
        dy = -dy

    # Draw everything
    screen.fill((0, 0, 0))
    pygame.draw.rect(screen, RED, (square_x, square_y, 50, 50))

    # Update the display
    pygame.display.flip()
    pygame.time.Clock().tick(60)

pygame.init()

# Set up some constants
WIDTH = 640
HEIGHT = 480
SPEED = 2

# Create the game window

    # Move the square

    if square_x < 0 or square_x > WIDTH - 50:

import pygame
import sys

# Initialize Pygame
pygame.init()

# Set up some constants
WIDTH = 640
HEIGHT = 480
SPEED = 2

# Create the game window
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((WIDTH, HEIGHT))

# Define some colors
RED = (255, 0, 0)

# Initialize the square's position and velocity
square_x = WIDTH // 2
square_y = HEIGHT // 2
dx = SPEED
dy = SPEED

# Game loop
while True:
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            pygame.quit()
            sys.exit()

    # Move the square
    square_x += dx
    square_y += dy

    # Bounce off the edges
    if square_x < 0 or square_x > WIDTH - 50:
        dx = -dx
    if square_y < 0 or square_y > HEIGHT - 50:
        dy = -dy

    # Draw everything
    screen.fill((0, 0, 0))
    pygame.draw.rect(screen, RED, (square_x, square_y, 50, 50))

    # Update the display
    pygame.display.flip()
    pygame.time.Clock().tick(60)




    


print("hello world")

# Define some colors

data.documentText:
import pygame
import sys

# Initialize Pygame
pygame.init()

# Set up some constants
WIDTH = 640
HEIGHT = 480
SPEED = 2

# Create the game window
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((WIDTH, HEIGHT))

# Define some colors
RED = (255, 0, 0)

# Initialize the square's position and velocity
square_x = WIDTH // 2
square_y = HEIGHT // 2
dx = SPEED
dy = SPEED

# Game loop
while True:
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            pygame.quit()
            sys.exit()

    # Move the square
    square_x += dx
    square_y += dy

    # Bounce off the edges
    if square_x < 0 or square_x > WIDTH - 50:
        dx = -dx
    if square_y < 0 or square_y > HEIGHT - 50:
        dy = -dy

    # Draw everything
    screen.fill((0, 0, 0))
    pygame.draw.rect(screen, RED, (square_x, square_y, 50, 50))

    # Update the display
    pygame.display.flip()
    pygame.time.Clock().tick(60)




    


print("hello world")
